ur_rna.StructureEditor.models

Class Motif.Loop

  • java.lang.Object
    • ur_rna.StructureEditor.models.Motif.Segment
      • ur_rna.StructureEditor.models.Motif.Loop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Nuc>, IMotif, INucGroup
    Enclosing class:
    Motif

    public static class Motif.Loop
extends Motif.Segment
implements IMotif
    A Loop represents a series of adjacent unpaired nucleotides. Loops can be categorized as follows:
    Hairpin
    A single-stranded region that connects one side of a helix to the other without any intervening helices. e.g.: A:B-C-D-E-F-(A) (Notation: X:Y represents a base-pair; X-Y represents a 3'-to-5' covalent bond between nucleotides X and Y. (A) means the same "A" nucleotide that appeared earlier in the sequence.)
    Internal Loop
    A single-stranded region that connects one side of a helix to the same side of another helix. (Same side means without any intervening helices. e.g.: A:B-C-D-E-F-G:H-[I-J-...]-(A) --There can be no intervening helices between H and A
    Multibranch Loop
    A series of single-stranded regions that connect multiple helices together. e.g.: A:B-C-D-E-F-G:H-I-J-K:L-M-N-(A)
    Terminal Loop
    A single-stranded regions that is only connected to a helix on one side. e.g.: A-B-C-D-E-F-G:H

      • getMultiBranchBasePairs

        public static java.util.List<Bond> getMultiBranchBasePairs(Nuc n,
                                                           boolean includeExteriorLoop)

      • getMultiBranchBasePairs

        public static java.util.List<Bond> getMultiBranchBasePairs(Nuc n,
                                                           boolean includeExteriorLoop,
                                                           Bond.MultiLoopRole basePairRole)
        Retrieve a list of all bonds that are part of a multi-branch loop. (i.e. the bases of all helices that extend from the multi-branch loop. The list is built by starting with n and traversing the strand in a forward direction, jumping across base-pairs until either n is reached again or the strand terminates. If the strand terminates before n is reached, the n nucleotide was NOT in a multi-branch loop, and NULL is returned.
        Parameters:
        n - Any nucleotide in the multi-branch loop. Note that if n is paired, it is technically possible for it to be simultaneously in two adjacent multi-branch loops (assuming it belongs to a "helix" containing only a single base-pair). For this reason, it is better to pass an unpaired nucleotide in for n, to avoid any ambiguity.
        includeExteriorLoop - if false, null is returned if the given nucleotide is part of an exterior loop. Otherwise all the branches starting at or after n will be included in the returned list (but those BEFORE n will not be.)
        basePairRole - Only applies when n is paired and the bases in either direction are unpaired (or paired to bases in different helices than n). (i.e. n is in a helix comprised of a single pair). This parameter imfluences how the basepair is interpreted -- as an exit or entrance pair.
        Returns:
        a list of bonds (if nStart was in fact in a multi-branch loop) or null otherwise.
